{ "step_by_step_thinking": "Iron deficiency anemia is characterized by a decrease in iron stores in the body. Ferritin, a protein that stores iron in the body, would decrease as the body's iron stores are depleted. Serum iron, the amount of circulating iron in the blood, would also decrease as the body has less iron to circulate. Transferrin saturation, which is a measure of the amount of iron bound to the protein transferrin, would also decrease as there is less iron available to bind. However, TIBC (Total Iron Binding Capacity) would increase in iron deficiency anemia. This is because as the body's iron stores decrease, it produces more transferrin in an attempt to bind and utilize any available iron.
